_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Skyland Grain, LLC is an agricultural retail business that focuses on grain storage for area producers as well as providing the necessary inputs for grain production. Skyland Grain, LLC strives to maintain a safe and healthy work place. Our owners, managers, and employees have made every

effort to plan the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.



Skyland Grain, LLC maintains and operates their Anhydrous Ammonia Plant in strict accordance with all state and local authorities. Senior Management reviews the status of each facility each month and institutes changes, when necessary, to make the facility safer. Our employees have been trained in their respective emergency actions, including the emergency meeting place and each of their individual responsibilities regarding an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. Skyland Grain, LLC. has employees that have been through HazWoper training (Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response.) The Kansas Department of Agriculture (KDA) inspects our plant on a regular basis and we comply with their requests for improvement. In addition, our facilities are in the SHARP's program so this adds another layer of examinations.



Our employees are trained in safety procedures, site-specific operating procedures, plant maintenance and employees are competency tested over the training material. Each employee uses ammonia resistant goggles and gloves during ammonia operations as well as always providing plenty of

emergency safety water during tank filling and maintenance operations.

With the above-mentioned training in mind, it makes it very easy to report that absolutely no injury actions or property damage have occurred at this facility since Skyland Grain, LLC. took over operations in 2016.



Skyland Grain, LLC.'s anhydrous ammonia program is designed to minimize risk to employees, any first responders, and the surrounding public. In addition, our program is designed to consult with the community and fir

st responders and coordinate response needs with the local emergency planning and response organizations and make sure they are aware of the hazards of anhydrous ammonia. Part of this coordination is discussing Skyland Grain, LLC.'s emergency action plan, their emergency contact information, and any other information that local emergency planning and response organizations identify as relevant to local emergency response planning.  This coordination also includes procedures for informing the public in the event of an emergency.
